I have a Silverlight app getting data from a CSLA wpfPortal that has Http Context enabled.

I'm not too familiar with Silverlight BUT....

All .NET applications have some kind of "entry point" where you can place all of your registration code. For WinForms/Console apps, it was Main(), for ASP.NET, it's in Application_Start. You don't need to worry about singletons, just a static class/method will work just fine. Registration code only needs to execute once, so putting it in the startup piece of Silverlight works fine.
